data.question: What technique is used to assess guest-accessible volume in MOFs?
What is the purpose of using a toolbox of dyes in the study?
data.answer: To assess the void volume of MOF by employing dyes with a wide range of sizes.

data.question: Is TPM applicable to non-crystalline materials?
What shapes do the dyes likely have?
Can MOF-5 accommodate dye 2b?
What is the maximum threshold size of the dye that KUMOF-2 can accommodate?
Does the thickness of the compound affect the diffusion efficiency into the MOF?
What is the aperture diameter of the channel in KUMOF-1?
Which dye shape penetrates more efficiently into the MOF?
Is the guest-accessible volume correlated with the entrapped dye size?
What framework was chosen for application with TPM?
Can COF-1 accommodate dye 5b?
What is the proposed stacking in COF-1?
data.answer: A staggered stacking to yield a 1D channel with an aperture of 7.0 Å

data.question: Is TPM a direct method to assess the void space of porous materials?
What is the advantage of TPM in analyzing thick porous materials?
data.answer: It offers the advantage of increased penetration depth (>500 mm).

data.question: Does the length of the compound matter more than its thickness for diffusion efficiency?
What is the role of the dyes in the study?
data.answer: To probe the guest-accessible volume within MOFs.
